channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Trump suggests government could take licenses of networks that are critical of him
item.description: President Trump celebrated the suspension of comedian Jimmy Kimmel and suggested the government could go after the licenses of broadcast networks that are critical of him.

item.title: What FCC chair's threats against ABC could mean for other media companies
item.description: Robert Corn-Revere with the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression talks about the effect the FCC chair's threats against ABC could have for other media companies.

item.title: 'It's time for people to stand up': Demonstrators protest Jimmy Kimmel's suspension
item.description: Demonstrators gathered outside the Hollywood studio where Jimmy Kimmel films his late night show to protest ABC's suspension of the comedian.

item.title: Miley Cyrus has never been 'super consistent.' She told us why that works for her
item.description: Miley Cyrus says she's never quite figured herself out — and that's influenced how she makes music.

item.title: Six-man football is more than touchdowns and wins in Texas: 'It's like an identity'
item.description: In the state's rural pockets, schools with fewer than 105 students can opt to play six-man football, a version of the game that takes fewer players and has its own special set of rules.

item.title: A judge ordered Google to share its search data. What does that mean for user privacy?
item.description: The ruling in the Google antitrust trial has led to a host of hard-to-answer questions about the future of Google's search data, which the tech giant must now share with competitors. What does that mean for users' data privacy?

item.title: In 'HIM,' football greatness comes with a price. Tyriq Withers is its rising star
item.description: In HIM, Withers plays a rising quarterback. His on-screen mentor, Marlon Wayans, had some real-life advice — and a reading list — for the young actor.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump celebrates the suspension of Jimmy Kimmel, CDC panel of advisers will vote on more vaccine recommendations Friday, Trump wants to designate antifa as a 'terrorist organization'

item.title: Texas governor calls for students to be punished for mocking Charlie Kirk's death
item.description: At least two college students have been expelled from Texas universities at Gov. Abbott's urging for expressing their thoughts on Charlie Kirk's death, raising concerns about free speech at schools.

item.title: AI is causing anxiety about the future of the workforce. But are there AI-proof jobs?
item.description: Can we know which jobs are more or less likely to be "taken" by artificial intelligence? Planet Money looks into what jobs might be immune from a robot takeover.
